highlighted_projects.description: Create a Utilities package including some modules to use in compositing jobs in VFX and add those functionalities in Nuke software interface. Those modules include renderFinished, exposeInFinder, readWrite. By using Python, Nuke Library, The Foundry Nuke, PyCharm.
highlighted_projects.name: Create some nuke plugins using Nuke Package

highlighted_projects.description: Utilizing Concordia University Engineering and Computer Science MYSQL DBMS server, to develop a university database system with several relation by using SQL, PHP
highlighted_projects.name: Develop a university database system

jarvis_projects.description: Deployed a project to collect hardware specification and also monitor the cluster nodes resource usage in real time. The collected data will be stored in an RDBMS database for this we use posgres sql database. The data can help to manage reports for future resource planning purposes.
jarvis_projects.name: Cluster Monitor

summary: Using Nuke as a main software when I was working for visual effect companies for a couple of years attracted me to the computer science. I honed my computer skills by graduating from Concordia University with a Graduate Diploma in Computer Science degree. Gained my quality assurance analyst expertise by joining to Morgan & Stanley company which gave me the opportunity to hand-on experience working closely with full-stack features teams to deliver complete components for boarder platform integration and leveraged various technologies and tools, including LINUX, SQL, GIT Bitbuckets, Object Oriented Programming (OOP), and delivered work using Agile (Kanban) methodologies, analyzed requirement and performed functional and regression tests based on developer instruction. Later, I started working as Junior Web Developer on site National Bank of Canada. Through using Java, Springboot, git bucket, Vault and Scrum as a methodology management, I worked in a project which created and stored secrets keys in the Vault and delivered work using Agile/ Scrum.
